dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 1270 IH: Restoring Access to Medication Act of 2015
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Jenkins of Kansas (for herself and Mr. Kind) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the amendments made by the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act which disqualify expenses for over-the-counter drugs under health savings accounts and health flexible spending arrangements.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Restoring Access to Medication Act of 2015.

section.header: Repeal of disqualification of expenses for over-the-counter drugs under certain accounts and arrangements

subsection.text: Section 223(d)(2)(A) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking the last sentence.
Section 220(d)(2)(A) of such Code is amended by striking the last sentence.

subsection.header: Health flexible spending arrangements and health reimbursement arrangements
subsection.text: Section 106 of such Code is amended by striking subsection (f).
The amendments made by this section shall apply to expenses incurred after December 31, 2014.
